cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 300 miles southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River and about 310 miles east of the mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: expected to slow, turn west then northwest, and drift toward the central Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda/Port O’Connor

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Port Aransas, TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande (TS Watch); Port Mansfield to High Island, TX (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coastline from Port Mansfield northward to High Island, including Corpus Christi Bay and adjacent barrier islands
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are possible late Sunday into Monday with a 46 % cumulative chance; low (17 %) chance of reaching 50-kt (58 mph) sustained.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible in Corpus Christi Bay and surrounding bays if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rain bands may produce totals well over 4 inches and localized flooding from Sunday through Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and life-threatening rip currents along area beaches; minor coastal erosion possible.
